author: Saurav Mukherjee
title: Gulzar backs writer’s protest, demands government to crackdown on communal forces
text:
Gulzar backs writer’s protest, demands government to crackdown on communal forces By Saurav Mukherjee on October 24, 2015 at 1:35 PM Comments 

Mumbai, October 24: Eminent writers, who returned their Sahitya Akademi awards citing growing intolerance in the country in the name of caste and religion, have a new supporter — Gulzar. The famous Urdu poet and famous Bollywood lyricist came out in open and slammed the government for failing to control the rising intolerance against caste and religion. He also sought a full stop to the politics being played in the name of recent killing, including one in Dadri, another in Faridabad and on the assassination of late Prof MM Kalburgi. 
Reacting on the prevailing situation of disharmony in the nation, due to which more than 35 writers and poets have returned their Sahitya Akademi awards as a protest, Gulzar said that earlier people were not asked their religion before they were asked their name. He said, “Pehle aisa mahoul toh nahii tha ki naam sey pehle dharam poocha jaata tha.” Gulzar was seen concerned and said that he is dissatisfied with the prevailing disharmony in the nation. (ALSO READ: Centre slams writers, poets for returning Sahitya Akademi awards; says way of protest won’t solve any purpose ) 
Expressing his dissatisfaction over the curb on freedom of speech, he said, “ Aisa mahaul pehle humne kabhi nahin dekha thaa, kum se kum baat karne kay liye bekhauf the.” He extended his support for the writers who gave away their awards, but also said that now suit has stopped. But his dissent over the politics remains intact. He said, “Ab kahan lautaye jaa rahe hain? Ye humare Akademi kay awards the, unko return karna ek protest thaa.” He also said that writers are peaceful people who are busy in their writing and have no time to play politics, so allegation on them are false. The poet said, “Writer kya raajneeti karega bechara, woh to bas dil ki baat keh raha hai, zameer ki baat kar raha hai. Writers are the conscience keepers of the society, woh samaaj kay zameer ko sambhalne wale log hain .” 
Taking a jibe at the people playing politics over the communal matters, he commented on ‘Ram Rajya’ that he would be glad to meet the communal forces who met ‘Ram’, because he can not see the ‘Ram Rajya’ (ideal state). Gulzar said, “Mujhe acha lagega unse milke jinko ‘Ram rajya’ mil gaya hai, aapko dikh raha hai?” However, he also said there is no fault of the Sahitya Akademi in the rising intolerance in the country, so putting the entire blame on it would also be not correct. (ALSO READ: Sahitya Akademi condemns murder of rationalist MM Kalburgi; appeals dissident writers to take back honours ) 
More than 35 writers and poets have written their Sahitya Akademi awards ion the wake of growing intolerance in the country and and also have cited institutions silence over the killings of Kannada writer MM Kalburgi who was murdered by two unidentified men on August 30 this year, at his Dharwad residence. Even after the meeting held at the institution on Friday, writers have revoked their decision to take back the awards.
